intro: Lagenocarpus tenuis, commonly known as the slender-fruited sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate habit and succulent, fleshy stems. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule. Lagenocarpus tenuis is adapted to survive in harsh, sandy soils and can tolerate periods of drought. It is often found in coastal and inland dune environments, contributing to stabilizing sandy soils.
